intro: Ornithoboea maxwellii var. minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, curved pods. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrublands or open woodlands. Its small, pale yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is known for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance. It is also valued in horticulture for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its drought tolerance.
